featured.text: The level of quality of PBS programs, whether in national and international news, entertainment, or education, is excellent.
At City Hall, Mayor Abraham Beame hosted a news conference that turned into a ceremony in George Willig's honor.
Maria didn’t want to deliver the bad news to David about his failing the job interview.
In the news recently was the story of a woman who died of a heart attack while driving her station wagon.

other.text: As more people rely on the Internet for information, it has newspapers as the most important source of news.
News about the phone gradually spread, and the booth has become a 28 between the living and the dead.
This is certainly good news for cash-strapped students.
To gain more ______, some legislators would get into violent physical fights so that they may appear in TV news reports.
Nor is it one of the cable networks such as CNN, which carries only news and news stories.

definition.zh_def: 新聞：報導當前事件或情況的資訊，通常透過報紙、電視、廣播或網絡傳播。
definition.en_def: News: Information about current events or situations, typically disseminated through newspapers, television, radio, or the internet.
definition.example: I read the news every morning to stay informed about the world.
